title: Model time synchronization errors in sensor streams

content.raw: We currently have noise models for sensor outputs, but the timestamp is always perfect. @asymingt mentioned that real sensors have clock drift that should be modeled. There are different clock error models, such as a quartz oscillator vs. the global time used in GNSS measurements. Also, there can be multiple signals that share the same clock, such as the different axes of an inertial measurement unit.
